private_information: I arrive at Nob Hill at 09:00
I am willing to travel between Nob Hill and Presidio
I prefer concise meetings but want to meet as many friends as possible today
visitor.goal: Meet as many friends as possible today, prioritizing a meeting with Matthew for at least 30 minutes during his availability.

private_information: I will be at Presidio from 11:00 to 15:15
I require a minimum meeting duration of 30 minutes
friend_matthew.goal: Meet the visitor for at least 30 minutes sometime between 11:00 and 15:15 at Presidio.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent availabilities and travel times, generate a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward planner that maximizes the number of meetings while satisfying the constraint to meet Matthew for at least 30 minutes.

public_information: Travel time Nob Hill to Presidio: 17 minutes
Travel time Presidio to Nob Hill: 18 minutes
Matthew availability: at Presidio from 11:00 to 15:15
Constraint: meet Matthew for a minimum of 30 minutes

availability.system_prompt: You are the visitor planning a day in San Francisco. Provide your available time windows, willingness to travel, travel assumptions, and preferences. Do not produce PDDL. Provide a structured description of possible meeting slots, earliest arrival times at friend locations given the public travel times, and any constraints.
availability.prompt: Your name is visitor. Based on the public information and your private information, list your available time windows for meetings, compute earliest possible arrival times at Presidio, and propose candidate meeting slots and durations you can accept today.

availability.system_prompt: You are Matthew providing your availability and meeting constraints. Provide exact availability windows, minimum meeting duration, flexibility and any constraints. Do not produce PDDL. Provide a structured confirmation of feasible meeting intervals and any preferences about start or end times.
availability.prompt: Your name is friend_matthew. Based on the public information and your private information, confirm your availability windows at Presidio, state the minimum meeting duration, and indicate any flexibility in scheduling.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL planning and scheduling. Integrate the availability reports and public travel times and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownward planner. Model locations Nob_Hill and Presidio, travel actions with durations, meeting actions with required durations, and a planning horizon that captures the day. Keep agent actions distinct. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The PDDL must encode an objective to maximize the number of meetings while ensuring a meeting with Matthew of at least 30 minutes during his availability.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Use the visitor and Matthew availability reports and the public travel times to build a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward. Ensure travel durations and meeting durations are encoded, ensure a constraint that a meeting with Matthew lasts at least 30 minutes between 11:00 and 15:15 at Presidio, and include modeling choices to allow optimizing the number of meetings.
